title: How to Make Cheesy Chicken Spinach Stuffed Shells

steps.headline: Sprinkle chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper and roast for 30-35 minutes.
Bring a large pot of water to boil and add salt if you'd like.
steps.description: Boil pasta shells until Al Dente, about 12 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain and rinse cooked pasta shells with cool water.
Separate any broken shells and put all intact shells on a tray.
When the chicken is done, dice two cups worth and set aside.
In a large bowl, stir together chicken, onion, garlic, and spinach.
In a separate bowl, stir together mayonnaise, ricotta cheese, cream cheese, and Parmesan cheese.
Add parsley and Italian seasoning to the wet ingredients.
Stir egg into the wet ingredients.
Fold 1 cup of Mozzarella cheese into the wet ingredients.
Add salt and pepper to taste, then combine cheese mixture and chicken mixture in a large bowl.
Spread half of the jar of spaghetti sauce into the bottom of a 9x13 inch casserole dish.
Stuff the shells with the chicken mixture and place in the pan.
Pour the remaining sauce over the shells, then cover and bake for 30-40 minutes.
Remove from oven carefully and remove cover.
steps.description: Top with remaining Mozzarella cheese, then bake uncovered for 7-10 minutes until cheese is melted.

text: Preheat oven to 450 °F (232 °C).  Sprinkle chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper and roast for 30-35 minutes.  Bring a large pot of water to boil and add salt if you'd like. Boil pasta shells until Al Dente, about 12 minutes. Drain and rinse cooked pasta shells with cool water.  Separate any broken shells and put all intact shells on a tray.  When the chicken is done, dice two cups worth and set aside.  In a large bowl, stir together chicken, onion, garlic, and spinach.  In a separate bowl, stir together mayonnaise, ricotta cheese, cream cheese, and Parmesan cheese.  Add parsley and Italian seasoning to the wet ingredients.  Stir egg into the wet ingredients.  Fold 1 cup of Mozzarella cheese into the wet ingredients.  Add salt and pepper to taste, then combine cheese mixture and chicken mixture in a large bowl.  Spread half of the jar of spaghetti sauce into the bottom of a 9x13 inch casserole dish.  Stuff the shells with the chicken mixture and place in the pan.  Pour the remaining sauce over the shells, then cover and bake for 30-40 minutes.  Remove from oven carefully and remove cover. Top with remaining Mozzarella cheese, then bake uncovered for 7-10 minutes until cheese is melted. Let cool slightly, then enjoy!  Finished.
